public class MechRule
extends Object
implements EvalInterface

If the mechanism rule {choose from set} {is, is not} violated ...

Constant Field Values

isPositive

private boolean isPositive
Whether the evaluator is satisfied if the rule is upheld (true) or if it is violated (false).

pKvalue

private double pKvalue
For ACID_PK, BASE_PK, the pK to compare against.

flags

private int flags
For NO_ZWITTERIONS, PKA_RULE, RES_CONNECT, flags on which steps to ignore, whether to consider positive atoms bearing an H; For NO_SAME_CHARGE_REACT, if on, allow proton transfers.

Constructor Detail

MechRule

public MechRule()
Constructor.

MechRule

public MechRule(String data)
         throws ParameterException
Constructor.

Parameters:
data - the coded data for this evaluator; format:
isPositive/rule/pKvalue/flags
The pKvalue (a double) and flags (an int) are only used for a few rules, and no rule uses both.
Throws:
ParameterException - if the coded data is inappropriate for this evaluator

isResponseMatching

public OneEvalResult isResponseMatching(Response response,
                                        String authString)
Determines whether the response violates the indicated rule.

Specified by:
isResponseMatching in interface EvalInterface
Parameters:
response - a parsed response
authString - null (required by interface)
Returns:
a OneEvalResult containing a boolean that is true if the evaluator has been satisfied. May also contain a response modified with color or automatically generated feedback or a message describing an inability to evaluate the response because it was malformed.
